summary.Title: APPLICATION ENGINEER

WorkPlace.Name: PROFILPARTNERS ApS
WorkPlace.Description: Profilpartners er en rekrutteringsvirksomhed, som besætter stillinger til et bredt udsnit af danske virksomheder.

HiringOrg.Name: PROFILPARTNERS ApS
HiringOrg.Description: Profilpartners er en rekrutteringsvirksomhed, som besætter stillinger til et bredt udsnit af danske virksomheder.

JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
Keyword: You will be the link between the R&D department and the customers

Workplace: Odense/Worldwide

Job description: 
This job is an important part of an ambitious growth plan where the company upscale all the activities also the application team, which today consist of two dedicated engineers.

As an application engineer at Enabled Robotics, which is a fast growing company specialised in robotic systems that integrate mobile robots with robotic arms, you will be a link between the R&D department and the customers World Wide.

You will be working closely with industrial customers. Therefore you need to have an understanding of their challenges and be serviceminded in facilitating the customers needs.

You work closely together with the sales channels internationally as you participate in the planning and specification of the projects. Afterwards you take responsibility for the assignment and execution of the project.

Your main focus is to take care of the deployment and integration of robots at customer sites and secure that the customers are satisfied.

You will be part of the setup and implementation of proof-of-concept projects internally and externally and for the specification and development of application modules that can be used across customers.

As you will meet the customers on their ballpark you will have significant responsibility for the success of customer projects and customer-driven developments.

Your primary place of work will be at the companys office at Agerhatten 27A, 5220 Odense SØ, but it is important that you are willing and able to travel for setting up the systems at end-users 

Personal characteristics:
You should have a strong technical background and experience in deploying robot and automation solutions for the industry.

Preferably you have international experience and are able to work with people from different cultures and backgrounds.

It is important that you are structured in your work, able to juggle between multiple tasks, and thrive in the dynamics of a growing company and the uncertainties that come from pushing the boundaries of how robots are used. Finally, it is important that you can work constructively together with your colleagues, but also that you can work independently and are willing to travel for longer periods of time when deploying systems internationally. 

Education: Technical background 

Workexperience:
You have international experience, great technical insight and experience with technical installations. It is an huge advantage if you have experience with deployment of mobile robots in particular MiR robots or you have been working with arms from Universal Robots. Experience in risk assessment of robot installations is preferred. 

Language & IT skills:
Fluent in English both spoken and written. Knowledge and understanding of production IT-systems (e.g. WMS or MES systems) and how to interface with these.

Salary: You will receive a salary that matches your qualifications.

You are offered:
An exciting workplace with varying tasks.

A great opportunity to grow with the company and shape your role over the next few years

A friendly and informal work environment

Plenty of responsibility and opportunities to grow with the company

Not forgetting: Social activities such as fortnightly free Friday bar, monthly pizza Friday and much more. 

Company Description:
In the last years Enabled Robotics has focused on technical developments and setting up sales channels internationally. Having recently received a significant investment from private investors the company is now ready to start upscaling and this also means strengthening the application team that are responsible for deployment and commissioning at strategic customers.
